meta_description: Eastern State preserves America's first penitentiary, advancing public understanding of the criminal justice system and its impact on the lives of those affected by it, to inspire a more just future.
hours_text:
Eastern State Penitentiary Historic Site is open to visitors year-round. Below you’ll find the latest information regarding our hours of operation, including any notices regarding unexpected closures or delays. All hours of operation are subject to change.

collections_text:
# Help Us Celebrate America’s 250th!

We’re celebrating America’s 250th anniversary in 2026! Will you make a gift today to ensure we’re ready to welcome visitors from our city, our country, and the whole world? Your donation supports A Time for Liberty—a yearlong series of free, inclusive programs exploring liberty and justice—and will also help us build a brand-new Welcome Center.

[Donate](/support/donate/our-latest-appeal?utm_source=easternstate.org&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=fa25_web_homepage_slider) Previous Next

# More Than a New Look

We have a brand-new look, but it’s so much more than that. Eastern State is a nonprofit dedicated to education about the criminal justice system. Read more about our bold new mission and vision for the future of this iconic institution.

[Learn More](/about/organizational-strategy) Previous Next

# Featured Program: Unlocking History

What was life like for women at Eastern State Penitentiary? What’s it like to return home after incarceration? How have prison sports programs changed over time? Unlocking History is a video series that examines the stories of everyday people and their lives at Eastern State Penitentiary and in prisons today.

[Learn More](/education/for-all-learners/unlocking-history) Previous Next

# Featured Program: Justice 101

Justice 101 is a discussion series examining the history of the justice system in America, from its founding to today, and the impact it has on society, citizens, and the world. Join us liv...
